comments:
DTP 1.6 11/1 build. 

The dependency on o.e.d.connectivity.ui has been removed from o.e.d.connectivity.db.generic. While this is all an fine, there still are classes in db.generic that need connectivity.ui. Trying to create a generic connection profile for example, fails with the following system.out text:

Migrated the driver class property editor for the generic driver definition to the new property editor extension point.  The extension was moved to the generic.ui plug-in where it belongs.

DTP 1.6 11/2 nightly build.

The driver field now shows up in the Generic JDBC template, but clicking on the browse button in that field gives an error:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor$1.run(DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor.java:138)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
Caused by: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
	at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
	at java.net.FactoryURLClassLoader.loadClass(URLClassLoader.java:580)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.DriverUtil.getDriverClassesFromJar2(DriverUtil.java:121)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.DriverUtil.getDriverClassesFromJar(DriverUtil.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor$1.run(DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor.java:135)
	... 1 more

John,

I cannot reproduce this error.  Can you tell me which JDK (vendor, version) you are using?
(Adjusting target milestone and severity for info to follow in next comment)

Environment: Eclipse 3.4M3 stack, Sun 1.5 VM, DTP 1.6M4 11/12 build

Ok -- this is a little strange. I dug into some more, and am now seeing an InvocationTargetException when trying to locate the driver class in a MySQL JDBC driver.

You can find the driver at:

http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/5.1.html

Note that you do not have to install MySQL for this test. Simply unpack the driver zip, point to mysql-connector-java-5.1.5-bin.jar in a Generic JDBC template definition, and click on the "..." field editor for the driver class to get the exception.

Tried the same with a bunch of other JDBC drivers for different db, and did not get the error. 

Additional notes:

* Hand-crafted a driver template in XML to get around this problem, and we are able to connect with and use the MySQL database as expected. (So, the driver does seem usable.)

* Appears to fail in the same way in the 1.5.x stream as well.

Perhaps there's nothing we can do about this, but it would be nice to find out why we can't read this particular JDBC driver in the dialog. Also, it would be useful if the driver class field were editable as text too, so the user could just type in a value when the browse fails.

There is already a defect opened against the DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor for not failing gracefully when an exception is thrown while looking for the driver classes in the jar/zip.  The original defect had to do with searching a jar that has been obfuscated.  I don't think there is anyway we can guarantee that DTP is compiled or running against a JDK with a higher version than every JDBC driver in the world so I think the best we can hope for is that it fails gracefully.
The original issue reported in this bug has been fixed. The secondary issue will be taken up in BZ197994

traces.message: Plug-in org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.db.generic was unable to load class org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.DriverClassBrowsePropertyDescriptor.
